hints_html: Multiplying a complex number means multiplying the real and the imaginary part. Adding complex numbers means adding the real parts and adding the imaginary parts separately.
hints_latex:
Multiplying a complex number means multiplying the real and the
imaginary part. Adding complex numbers means adding the real parts and
adding the imaginary parts separately.
hints_raw: Multiplying a complex number means multiplying the real and the imaginary part. Adding complex numbers means adding the real parts and adding the imaginary parts separately.
question: A 22
statement_html:
For questions A22 - A24 below, \(u\), \(z\) are complex numbers given below:

\[\begin{aligned} u = 3 + 2i, \quad z = 1 - i\end{aligned}\]

A22: Evaluate \(2u - z\). Your answer should be in the form \(a + ib\) where \(a\) and \(b\) are real numbers.
statement_raw:
For questions <b>A22 - A24</b> below, <math>u</math>, <math>z</math> are complex numbers given below:

:<math>
u = 3 + 2i, \quad z = 1 - i
</math>

<b>A22</b>: Evaluate <math>2u - z</math>. Your answer should be in the form <math>a + ib</math> where <math>a</math> and <math>b</math> are real numbers.
